alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:12PM EST until January 09 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN AMELIA, SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE EDWARD, NORTHWESTERN LUNENBURG AND NORTHWESTERN NOTTOWAY COUNTIES... At 612 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crewe, Burkeville, Green Bay, Rice, Jetersville, Rehoboth, Morven, Twin Lakes State Park, Prince Edward Lake, Burkes Tavern, Prince Edward Station, Oliveville, Moran, Scholfield, Rubermount, Jennings Ordinary, Nutbush, Meherrin, Virso and Arvins Store. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
